intro: Ribesiodes dasythyrsum, commonly known as the velvetleaf plant, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in a fine, velvety texture. The plant produces showy, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, often attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Its growth habit is typically herbaceous, though it can become semi-woody in certain conditions.
